nl_query: Find all customers who made more than three purchases in the past month.
explanation: Relational databases are optimized for handling joins and aggregations quickly.

nl_query: Get all employees who have been with the company for more than five years and work in the sales department.
explanation: SQL allows filtering and searching on specific columns with indexed queries.

nl_query: List all products with stock levels below the reorder threshold.
explanation: Relational databases efficiently handle querying with conditional operators.

nl_query: Retrieve the top 10 highest grossing movies from the past decade.
explanation: Sorting and limiting results are efficiently handled by SQL queries.

nl_query: Find pairings of customers and their highest paid jobs completed this year.
explanation: Complex joins and subqueries are efficiently processed by SQL.

nl_query: Get a list of suppliers with their average delivery times.
explanation: Aggregation functions are optimized in relational databases for performance.

nl_query: Identify all students who scored above 90 in math and are enrolled this semester.
explanation: Relational databases excel in searching and filtering based on multiple criteria.

nl_query: Fetch all blog posts with more than 100 comments.
explanation: Databases efficiently manage indexed searches on related tables.

nl_query: List all orders that include a specific product with their total cost.
explanation: Multiple joins across tables are handled well in relational operations.

nl_query: Find all transactions involving customers in the top 10% spending bracket.
explanation: Subqueries and ranking using functions like `RANK()` or `NTILE()` are efficient in SQL.

nl_query: Get all items sold in the last year grouped by category and summed by revenue.
explanation: Grouping and summarizing data is naturally suited to SQL queries.

nl_query: Retrieve a list of employees and their managers, showing department hierarchies.
explanation: Hierarchical queries involving self joins are efficiently supported.

nl_query: Show all active subscriptions and their payment histories for the past year.
explanation: Efficient handling of time based queries and related data retrieval.

nl_query: List projects with deadlines in the next month and their assigned team members.
explanation: Combining time conditions with joins is efficient on relational databases.

nl_query: Find all doctors who have conducted more than 50 surgeries this year.
explanation: Capability for quick calculations and condition checks.

nl_query: Fetch a report of total sales grouped by month and region.
explanation: Group by and aggregate functions provide efficient reporting capabilities.

nl_query: Identify all flights with more than 80% occupancy in the past three months.
explanation: Relational databases efficiently evaluate conditions across large datasets.

nl_query: List top 5 customers by total lifetime value.
explanation: SQL supports sorting and ranking across potentially large data volumes.

nl_query: Get details of all loans approved with amounts greater than $50,000.
explanation: Efficiently manages selection criteria with index based searches.

nl_query: Find all authors who have published more than three bestsellers.
explanation: Joins and filters over multiple tables benefit from relational database optimization.

nl_query: Retrieve all insurance claims filed in the last quarter with their approval status.
explanation: Temporal queries and status filtering are straightforward.

nl_query: Show all hotels in the database with average ratings above 4.5.
explanation: Aggregating ratings is easily managed with optimizations.

nl_query: List customer feedback responses received in the last 30 days.
explanation: Efficiency in sorting and fetching time based records.

nl_query: Generate a list of all employees eligible for a performance bonus this year.
explanation: Complex conditions involving multiple criteria are efficiently processed.

nl_query: Identify top performing salespersons with sales above a certain target.
explanation: Rank and filter data over multiple criteria using built in SQL capabilities.

nl_query: Retrieve all marketing campaigns active in the current quarter.
explanation: Date based filtering is efficiently executed.

nl_query: Get a list of products along with their suppliers and latest price updates.
explanation: Multi table joins and date based selections perform well on indexed columns.

nl_query: Find all classes with enrollment quotas exceeded.
explanation: Simple but efficient queries around limits and constraints.

nl_query: List all new product launches planned for the next six months.
explanation: Forecasting queries are well suited for relational time based search.

nl_query: Fetch customer rental history and flag overdue accounts.
explanation: Combining customer and transaction data with conditions is efficient.

nl_query: Get a detailed report of all vehicles serviced with parts used and costs incurred.
explanation: Complex relationships and joins processed effectively.

nl_query: Identify all online orders with an express delivery option chosen.
explanation: Filtering and selection based on specific attributes work well.

nl_query: Retrieve a ranking of articles based on views in the last month.
explanation: SQL's ranking functions work efficiently on properly indexed tables.

nl_query: List all open support tickets from customers, categorized by priority level.
explanation: Efficient categorization and prioritization through filtering and sorting.
